author: Alyssa Marie
text: 'This place was blah‚Ä¶\nPad Thai: noodles with veg
column5: there was zero sauce on it\nHibachi Beef: very bland

author: Hannah Khattab
text: 'I reserved a table for 7:30. Got seated at 7:15 and didn‚Äôt get our food until almost 9pm. After waiting
column5: my food came out half cold which is understood because it is busy but when I told the waiter
column6: I got a blank stare. Not even an I‚Äôm sorry or anything else she can do. Probably one of the worst encounters I‚Äôve had with a server at a restaurant. My sushi came out 30 mins after my food and it was the smallest portion I‚Äôve ever had in my life. After dropping a good $45 alone
column7: I would not recommend coming back here.'

author: Woman
text: 'The sushi was alright. It was not bad but there a definitely better places to order from'

author: PX
text: "Location is close to the river (2 blocks) and has a fair amount of outdoor seating with some river views. The food is mediocre
column5: bland and overpriced. Our waitress was good but the environment wasn't inviting. We gave this place a shot based on reviews and came here over our usual spot in Edgewater
column6: NJ because we wanted to try something new. Don't waste your money on the cocktails/drinks or food. We have no plans on coming back after spending nearly $200 for two people and leaving unsatisfied."

text: 'The sushi was the best I‚Äôve had in NJ so far. It was well worth the price. We went at an off time and didn‚Äôt have a reservation but were quickly sat and served. The drinks were tasty and the ambiance was spot on. 10/10 recommend and will be coming back!'

text: 'Great service.'

author: Geena Anderson
text: 'My boyfriend and I randomly decided to come here one day and we now go here almost every time we come to Hoboken. The sushi is delicious (Philly & Rainbow roll
column5: boyfriend orders spicy tuna roll) & it has a great atmosphere. Service is a little slow
column6: but I always look forward to coming back here!'

author: Lindsay Ward
text: 'Everything was delicious. Atmosphere was great! Only thing we complained on was slow service getting our food. But great place!'

author: Tanya Christian
text: "My first and last visit to Sushi Lounge was disappointing to put it nicely. While I want to believe the restaurant was simply having an off day
column5: my experience was enough to lead me not return. From the time my guest and I checked in
column6: things gradually went down hill. To start off
column7: we were seated for more than 20 minutes before our waitress came to take our order
column8: and that was after I walked inside and brought it to the attention of the host. I excused this because the wait staff was apologetic
column9: and were kind enough to comp our 2 cocktails
column10: but my issues didn't end there. My fianc√© ordered the shrimp risotta and seemed to enjoy it
column11: but I was disappointed that the shrimp was overcooked (read: tough). The second starter was calamari
column12: and by far the worse dish we had that night. It was obvious from the rubbery/ extra chewy texture that the calamari was overcooked as well (it's even obvious from the photos). I brought it to the attention of my waiter who apologized and then removed the plate from the table. We proceeded to delve into our sushi rolls. Both of us ordered spicy rolls (one shrimp
column13: one crab) but the spice wasn't at all evident. I was extremely underwhelmed. When the check came our waitress let us know that they took 30% off of the calamari starter. Though I didn't make a fuss
column14: I do think it was in poor taste that they would remove the dish from our table (after only having a few bites) and not completely remove it from the tab
column15: altogether. Every restaurant does customer service differently but I found that a bit crass on the restaurant's part. The truth is we were hoping to have a full meal (starters
column17: and entrees) at the Sushi Lounge
column18: but by the time we made it to the rolls
column19: it was obvious we needed to cut our losses. This restaurant gets 3 stars overall because I want to believe the waitstaff did what was in their power to make it a pleasent dining experience. If I was judging food and drinks alone

author: Jessica Miranda
text: 'Food was delicious though a little pricey. Takes awhile to get the waiters attention when sitting outside. Area is nice and outdoor area was very clean and inviting.'

author: Elizabeth D'Amato
text: 'Great experience. Sushi was delicious. A really great Kani Salad (sauce on the lighter side and a little spicy kick) as well as their sushi rolls (Atomic & Totowa). Atomic had a good amount of heat to it. Also had a great cocktail menu..highly recommend.'

author: Milton Ribeiro
text: 'Food was very good. We had tuna and salmon sashimi
column5: and spicy tuna rolls. Service was slow and uneven but that seems to be the trend in the NY area these days. It kind of makes me miss the old days of "rude but efficient" :-). They made us sit by the street curb
column6: which was not pleasant. We will be back for the food
column7: though.'

text: 'The service was really wack but the food is soooooooo good.\n\nCame on a Friday at 6:30. There wasn‚Äôt a clear spot for the host stand so I awkwardly stood around. I made a reservation on open table

column6: there‚Äôs no option that specifies if you want indoor or out. The indoor has no ambiance
column7:
it feels like you‚Äôre in a club.

The food though was really good. Start with the crispy rice cakes with spicy tuna on top. I just got the salmon avocado roll and the salmon was really fresh and creamy which I love.

I‚Äôd come here again but only if I could sit outside lol‚Ä¶'

text: 'We ordered sushi from here last night for my sisters birthday and spent the entire night and all morning in the bathroom. I sincerely feel we have food poisoning. We got the spicy tuna

column6: Hoboken

author: James Pecora
text: 'As a restaurant manager I‚Äôm so disappointed with this restaurant. Me and my girlfriend used to order here regularly but it seems like every time we do the quality of food and service continues to diminish. Tonight I called to order pick up and was told I had to do this through the website and could not place it over the phone. And then it was not until I had picked up my food and gotten home that I realized 3 of my ordered items were missing. Which having known or been informed I would have cancelled my order and gone elsewhere. But of course no one had made me aware of that when picking up my food. When I called to resolve the issue of course there was no manager to speak with only a nasty employee. And this is not the first time I‚Äôve been told that when calling to resolve an issue. I will never order from here again. Overpriced and overrated.'

text: 'Horrible place!!! Manager did not wear a mask even though he was tending patrons and manning the register.  Food quality was well below average
column5:
and table service very poor.

There are far better places in the area to select  for those seeking Japanese style cuisine.

Pricing high compared to the quality of food and service.'

author: Jose Bustamante
text: 'Great atmosphere and owesome atencion'

author: Radha Kapoor
text: 'Unfortunately
column5: I have a shellfish allergy
column6: and love Sushi. I have never had an issue eating sushi despite this allergy. Unfortunately
column7: this past weekend I did. I informed the waitress that I had an allergy to shellfish (shrimp
column9: lobster) and ordered two rolls ( shellfish free rolls) and specified that they be on a plate separate from all the other sushi being ordered. I was served ( and ate) a roll that had shrimp inside of the roll. According to the staff
column10: the chef put the wrong sauce on top of the roll
column11: which somehow explained why I was served shellfish. I had a severe allergic reaction
column12: left dinner to go get an Epi pen
column13: and came back to a bill from the manager( who was well aware that I was having a severe allergic reaction from the meal they served me). We declined the bill
column14: asked to speak with the owner
column15: who was on "vacation" to return on Monday. Well its Wednesday
column16: we still havent gotten a phone call or apology. I am still suffering the consequences of the allergic reaction I had 5 nights ago. Please beware of this place if you have allergies

text: "I walk by this place many times and always want to try
column5: but never got around to it until now.\nWe ordered shashito peppers & coconut shrimp as appetizers. Peppers weren't as tasty and we'll salted to my liking
column6: but still delicious. Coconut shrimp came w/three long pieces
column7: each piece deep fried in coconut flakes.\nWe ordered three different specialty rolls: Hoboken
column9: and Motown. All very delicious. If you love spicy as I do
column10: crazy8 is made w/jalapenos - perfect spicy for a roll.\nMy 4 star is due to the drink. I ordered the sake punch and did not like it at all. I made my husband try it w/o knowing my personal opinion and we both agreed it tasted like cough syrup. Would definitely not order again."

text: 'Good food
column5: awesome service
column6: and outdoor seating in the heart of Hoboken. We went here with friends and all four of us enjoyed everything! We had specialty sushi rolls and started with a kani salad... added a few drinks (they have a full bar) to make it a perfect night with outdoor seating.'

author: Erica Cisneros
text: 'Went for dinner and was very impressed. Service was great. Servings are big and the chilled saki was delicious.'

author: Jason Oermann
text: 'Trendy vibe and creative sushi rolls.  One of the better sushi restaurants in Hoboken.  Perfect for a date!'

author: Madelaine DeLuca
text: 'Had the worst sushi I have ever had. It was WARM
column5: mushy and nothing tasted fresh. Ordered 4 rolls and they provided ginger and wasabi for roll. Go to illuzion or robongi instead. I called to tell them about the meal and how 1/3 of it was basically inedible and was provided with the reasoning that they got a big hit of orders and probably rushed it which doesn‚Äôt seem fair to me to then be offered not even a small refund or some credit to come back again.'

author: Yash Jafari
text: 'Food was not good
column5: and tasted as if it was microwaved. We ordered the hibachi dinner.'

author: Chris Terzini
text: 'Great menu. Excellent service.very nice staff.üòé'

author: Tanner Armstrong
text: 'overpriced'

author: Elizabeth Henry
text: 'love it will be back soon'

author: Adi Ezer
text: 'Very good lunch specials
column5: great value for money. Poke ball was really nice.'

author: Russell Morgan
text: "Great food
column5: service
column6: prices. I'll be back"

author: Valeria Lombo
text: 'Ok sushi place
column5: also offering hot appetizers and stir-fry dishes. I usually go for lunch specials
column6: but wish the house salad was more elaborated. Inside the restaurant is a bit dark
column7: try sitting outside if the weather allows'

author: Erika Bracy
text: 'Very good sushi and cocktails.'

author: Natali Gonzalez
text: 'Yummy sushi
column5: nice food happy hour
column6: decent service
column7: i recommend'

author: Stan Fernandes
text: "This place is pretty nice. It's a small upscale sushi restaurant with some interesting dishes. All the food we had was pretty good. The seafood was very fresh
column5: and the service was excellent.\n\nIt looks pretty modern inside regarding the decor. They do have a full bar and they did have some drink specials going while that we were there."

author: Antonio Aguirre
text: 'Great food and ambiance'

author: Rosalia Gil
text: 'The 1st time I was there the food was very good the drinks were very good the 2nd time I went we set out the table the food was not a good came back with the food cold hide a terrible waitress was not happy with the service'

author: julian delpino
text: "Not the best tasting Sushi but it's not horrible either. Middle of the road type place."

author: Lorelei Morrow
text: 'My sashimi was dry... -____-'

author: Ask Me
text: "Not great sushi  does not seem great  grade taste was to fishy.   Drinks and service  was not good either  mgr had to do both jobs and mix drinks to pricey for food quality  and service.    I'm staying  away"

author: Luca Bessi
text: 'The plain sushi is decent but rolls are a total failure. The more the roll is elaborated the more it is horrible. I gave to this place a second chance. Never again!'

author: Alexander Vezza
text: 'Best sushi experience in Hoboken. Great drink specials'

author: Stephanie Callahan
text: "I've been here for lunch a handful of times over the last few years and continue to leave disappointed. The sushi is average (thats the only thing I've ever ordered)
column5: but the service is just terrible. Whenever I've been in there there's only been a few other patrons
column6: so never very busy
column7: and the service is SLOW. Slow to take your order
column9: and slow to get your check. One of the last times I was in there
column10: we finally had to go ask for our check. We had been there for over an hour for lunch and had to get back to the office. If it was busy due to a lunch rush
column12: but our group of 3 were the only ones in the restaurant. The waitresses are always just standing around. I also find the seating highly uncomfortable. Feels like your sitting on top of the person next to you
column13: I couldn't imagine going to dinner here."

author: Sadie Guzman
text: 'Delicious'

author: Ajay Reddy
text: 'Without a doubt my fave sushi spot in all of Jersey. Glad my buddy took me here a couple years back when I was in the mood for sushi. They have the freshest fish of anywhere I have been to in the state and I always have a good time when I‚Äôm there. Ashley is an awesome bartender. She makes great drinks and always has good recommendations for sushi to try. Def recommend coming here to anyone whose a sushi fan. You won‚Äôt be disappointed.'

author: Brandon Plitt
text: "Instantly greeted at the door. It was clean and calming. I sat at the bar
column5: the waitress gave me my time to situate myself and then perfectly greeted me with a menu. Although not many people were there at my time of eating
column6: I was served promptly. The sushi rolls where great. If I had to nitpick one thing
column7: it would only be
column8: that they could have cut the roll into smaller pieces and that's not even a big deal. My check was brought to me in a timely manner and I will be coming back again."

author: Iron
text: 'really cozy and nice
column5: food is really good and they serve fast
column6: but they cook salmon in their teriyaki for some reason...'

author: Kelly Gallagher
text: "Very cool. I went for my birthday dinner. The music is louder than I personally want a sushi place to be
column5: but the music was excellent... What are you gonna do? It's a bar
column6: too.  I can deal with that. There was even a DJ the Thursday night I was there.\n\nThe rolls were unique and delicious and the service was excellent.  Best liquor selection of any sushi place I've been to."

author: Monique D
text: "Orgasmic food. Best sushi I've had in Jersey ever."

author: Anton B.
text: "A nice fusion between a sushi place and American
column5: if you're looking for a place that is a combination of a bar and sushi place
column6: this place definitely worth a shot. The food was good and the prices reasonable."

author: Kay UdeGod
text: "Service is terrible. Waitress rarely came by the table  and the place wasn't even packed. She ended up screwing up our chicken fried rice order and give us a chicken teriyaki. Food was bland at best
column5: tasteless in every aspect. Worst sushi I ever had. Definitely wouldn't recommend. Save your money and go anywhere else on Washington street"

author: geoff geruso
text: 'Order sushi only
column5: staff  was on the tennis if it‚Äôs slow
column6: meal took over an hour
column7: overall experience was not great'

author: Monica Saliceti
text: 'Great food. Love the staff and how attentive they were. Bartenders suggested a nice variety of beverages. Trendy hip atmosphere and clean.'

author: Aaron Brandt
text: 'Some of the best in the Country!'

author: Diana May
text: "So I've been here twice.  The cooks in the back are doing a great job
column5: because the food is good. But this place gets a poor review because the SERVICE SUCKS! The first time I brought my wall street friend to this place. Needless to say
column6: these kind of new yorkers don't like time wasted or poor service. INTOLERANT is an understatement! Long story short
column7: after 16 minutes of no one coming up to even take our order
column8: not even a glass of water
column9: we left WITHOUT eating! The guy has places to be
column10: & nj already sucks because sushi place has servers giggling by the bar & playing on their phones
column11: yet we were waiting for our orders to be taken.\n\nThe second time
column13: same story.  The girl servers are immature & probaby don't really care for this job or the customers.  The girls were busy on their phones in customers' plain view & were chatting & laughing by the bar
column14: WHILE SERVICE HAD NOT BEEN RENDERED. Again
column15: we were waiting for someone to even get our order & when someone did
column16: it was another bout of waiting for the food to be served. Additionally
column17: no one checked whether we needed anything once they brought our OVERDELAYED orders to the table. My friends & I will not be coming back. There are sushi places well deserving of our business.\n\nAdvice for management: FIRE YOUR INEPT GIRLS/SERVERS and hire people who are serious about their work! Otherwise

author: Iris Morales
text: 'A very pleasant and warm hospitality !'

author: Anna Borysova
text: 'Risotto is awesome'

author: Alexander Shvartsburd
text: 'Excellent.'

author: Michael M
text: 'Service was fantastic..rolls were tasty and came out pretty fast even with a number of people there. Definitely get the tempura green tea ice cream!'

author: Greg Mercado
text: 'Great happy hour deal.'

author: Raphaela Montinez
text: 'Not bad at all!!! Service was a bit slow
column5: but maybe they were busy.'

author: laura sanchez
text: "I've been here a few times. I love the food and blood orange martini is my favorite. But the food is literally the only reason I go back. Happy hour is a great price. But unfortunately the girls freaking suck. Every time I go I'm always waiting to take my order
column5: one time my food came b4 my actual drink and it was the wrong drink. My entree finally came and so did my correct drink. I also went another time and sat outside. They must of forgot I was there. I went inside and asked to take my order since I was outside. My app and entree took forever not even to mention I still had to wait for them to charge me. So again here we go
column6: I decided let me stop in for some sushi. They sat me on the top side said my waiter was coming. 15 mins passes and no one came. So today I gave up! I actually walked out and they told me have a good day. Didn't even notice that I wasn't even offered any type of service! Not even water. As I'm walking down the stairs i see 3 ladies and all of them staring at there phones. One is sitting at the round table blond hair girl
column7: her text must of been better than trying to make some money off of me with that huge smile she had on her with her head down onto the phone. Back to one of my other visits with a co worker she also agreeed that the service was terrible and commented that our waiter on her last experience was a no show and decided to stop by the bath room and she was doing her make up. We laughed and decided let's hit the rest room before we leave and we were still waiting for our checks. Sure enough guess who was there! Our waitress putter her lipstick on. Lol! I'm actually officially done with that place. I've meet the owner once and she's a nice lady! You need to fire everyone and gather a new team. The front of the house is what holds the foundation of a restaurant to bring customers back. I and many people I know don't go back because of the service. I wish you guys luck. Today my bill could of easily been 60 bucks since there was no happy hour but instead I paid $16 for two sandwiches at jimmy johns down the block. So actually thank you for Turning down my business saved my self $44."

author: Nik E
text: 'Good service and good sushi. Maybe one of the best in NJ.'

author: Diego QR
text: 'Highly recommend the Sea Bass.'

author: Cyan Perry
text: 'Very overpriced.'

author: David Fox
text: 'Never had anyone evengive us a menu. After 15 minutes of being ignored we left.'

author: Nick Bredahl
text: 'great sushi and amazing happy hour specials'

author: Axel M T
text: 'My favorite sushi spot'
